nodes.description: At least 17 people were killed and 28 others injured when a car bomb exploded in Somalia’s capital Mogadishu on Monday, July 22.
nodes.support_text: At least 17 people were killed and 28 others injured when a car bomb exploded in Somalia’s capital Mogadishu on Monday, July 22.

nodes.description: The explosion at the first checkpoint on the road to Mogadishu airport near the Afrik Hotel reverberated throughout the city, and sent a massive plume of black smoke into the air.
nodes.support_text: The explosion at the first checkpoint on the road to Mogadishu airport near the Afrik Hotel reverberated throughout the city, and sent a massive plume of black smoke into the air.

nodes.description: The al-Qaeda-linked al-Shabaab insurgent group claimed responsibility for the attack, saying it was a suicide bomb.
nodes.support_text: The al-Qaeda-linked al-Shabaab insurgent group claimed responsibility, saying that it was a suicide bomb.

nodes.description: Deputy Police Commissioner Zakia Hussein said on Twitter that security forces intercepted a Toyota Noah vehicle that then exploded.
nodes.support_text: Deputy Police Commissioner Zakia Hussein said on Twitter that security forces intercepted a Toyota Noah vehicle that then exploded.

nodes.description: The bodies of 17 people killed in the blast were taken to the hospital mortuary while 28 others were admitted for various wounds.
nodes.support_text: The bodies of 17 people killed in the blast were taken to the hospital mortuary while 28 others were admitted for various wounds.

nodes.description: Witnesses reported being knocked to the ground by the force of the blast, which damaged nearby buildings.
nodes.support_text: Witnesses reported being knocked to the ground by the force of the blast, which damaged nearby buildings.

nodes.description: The bombing comes just over a week after 26 people were killed and 56 injured in a complex 12-hour bomb and gun attack carried out by Al-Shabaab insurgents at a hotel in Kismayo, a port city in southern Somalia.
nodes.support_text: The bombing comes just over a week after 26 people were killed and 56 injured in a complex 12-hour bomb and gun attack carried out by Al-Shabaab insurgents at a hotel in Kismayo, a port city in southern Somalia.

nodes.description: Al-Shabaab fighters have fought for more than a decade to overthrow the internationally backed government in Somalia, and have also carried out attacks in neighboring Kenya.
nodes.support_text: Al-Shabaab fighters have fought for more than a decade to overthrow the internationally backed government in Somalia, and have also carried out attacks in neighboring Kenya.

nodes.description: In 2010, al-Shabaab pledged allegiance to al-Qaeda and has since been a key threat to peace in Somalia despite losing many strongholds and being driven out of major cities by AMISOM.

nodes.description: The martyrdom operation was carried out using a vehicle loaded with explosives which targeted a checkpoint along the airport road.

nodes.description: 目击爆炸的安全官员阿卜杜拉希·阿明表示，袭击中至少有两名政府安全人员在检查点丧生。
nodes.support_text: Abdullahi Ahmed, a security officer who witnessed the blast, said at least two government security officers at the checkpoint were killed in the attack.

nodes.description: 一名目击者阿卜迪卡里姆·穆罕默德表示，他离爆炸现场不远，看到许多人躺在地上，其中一些人已经死亡，血迹斑斑。

nodes.description: The event is reported by AFP (Agence France-Presse).

edges.support_text: The explosion at the first checkpoint on the road to Mogadishu airport near the Afrik Hotel reverberated throughout the city, and sent a massive plume of black smoke into the air.
The al-Qaeda-linked al-Shabaab insurgent group claimed responsibility, saying that it was a suicide bomb.
Deputy Police Commissioner Zakia Hussein said on Twitter that security forces intercepted a Toyota Noah vehicle that then exploded.
The martyrdom operation was carried out using a vehicle loaded with explosives which targeted a checkpoint along the airport road.
The bodies of 17 people killed in the blast were taken to the hospital mortuary while 28 others were admitted for various wounds.
Abdullahi Ahmed, a security officer who witnessed the blast, said at least two government security officers at the checkpoint were killed in the attack.
Witnesses reported being knocked to the ground by the force of the blast, which damaged nearby buildings.
一名目击者阿卜迪卡里姆·穆罕默德表示，他离爆炸现场不远，看到许多人躺在地上，其中一些人已经死亡，血迹斑斑。

The bombing comes just over a week after 26 people were killed and 56 injured in a complex 12-hour bomb and gun attack carried out by Al-Shabaab insurgents at a hotel in Kismayo, a port city in southern Somalia.
Al-Shabaab fighters have fought for more than a decade to overthrow the internationally backed government in Somalia, and have also carried out attacks in neighboring Kenya.
In 2010, al-Shabaab pledged allegiance to al-Qaeda and has since been a key threat to peace in Somalia despite losing many strongholds and being driven out of major cities by AMISOM.
In 2010, al-Shabaab pledged allegiance to al-Qaeda. The following year the group was pushed out of Somalia’s capital Mogadishu by AMISOM.
The following year the group was pushed out of Somalia’s capital Mogadishu by AMISOM. In 2012 it was driven out of Kismayo.
